retort noun [C]
(CONTAINER)
a container in which substances are heated at high temperatures, especially in a factory : Since the 1700s, gas has been made by baking coal in airtight retorts.
a glass container with a long neck (= top upright part), used in chemical experiments: On the various shelves were retorts, beakers, distilling tubes, and burners.
